citations.narrative:
Complete and up to date acquisition/disposition information was unavailable at the time of inspection for some animals at
the facility for pygmy goats acquired this year, a skunk that passed away sometime possibly this spring, and three
chickens. Records of acquisition and disposition can be important in animal health tracking. Records must correctly
disclose the following information concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned,
held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or
otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born or hatched of any animal
while in his or her possession or under his or her control, to the extent that any identification or counting of offspring can
be carried out without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities.
Ensure to maintain acquisition and disposition records up to date.
***Correct by 7/19/2024.

On the south area of the pygmy goat area three screws were sticking out where the older goats and llama could possibly
contact them. Screw points could possibly injure animals. Ensure that this area is repaired and that surfaces are free from
sharp points.

One of the southeast posts for the perimeter around the wolves is broken by the ground and leans toward the wolf
enclosure. If left in disrepair, it could allow the public to get too close to the wolves and also might not serve as a
secondary containment for the wolves. Ensure that this post is repaired/replaced so that the perimeter fence is structurally
sound and maintain the perimeter fence in good repair.
***Correct by 7/18/2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility provides oppurtunity for enrichment and socially houses their birds, however a written program of
environmental enhancement to promote psychological well-being of birds has not been completed. A plan for
environmental enhancement for birds that is developed with and approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) is required
and helps ensure birds are proved with adequate enrichment and social housing. Ensure to work with the AV to maintain
an approved written plan for environmental enhancement for the birds at the facility.
***Correct by August 9, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Complete and up to date acquisition/disposition information was unavailable at the time of inspection for some animals at 
the facility for pygmy goats acquired this year, a skunk that passed away sometime possibly this spring, and three 
chickens. Records of acquisition and disposition can be important in animal health tracking. Records must correctly 
disclose the following information concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, 
held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or 
otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born or hatched of any animal 
while in his or her possession or under his or her control, to the extent that any identification or counting of offspring can 
be carried out without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities. 
Ensure to maintain acquisition and disposition records up to date.  
***Correct by 7/19/2024. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
On the south area of the pygmy goat area three screws were sticking out where the older goats and llama could possibly 
contact them. Screw points could possibly injure animals. Ensure that this area is repaired and that surfaces are free from 
sharp points. 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
One of the southeast posts for the perimeter around the wolves is broken by the ground and leans toward the wolf 
enclosure. If left in disrepair, it could allow the public to get too close to the wolves and also might not serve as a 
secondary containment for the wolves. Ensure that this post is repaired/replaced so that the perimeter fence is structurally 
sound and maintain the perimeter fence in good repair. 
***Correct by 7/18/2024. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.

The facility provides oppurtunity for enrichment and socially houses their birds, however a written program of 
environmental enhancement to promote psychological well-being of birds has not been completed. A plan for 
environmental enhancement for birds that is developed with and approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) is required 
and helps ensure birds are proved with adequate enrichment and social housing. Ensure to work with the AV to maintain 
an approved written plan for environmental enhancement for the birds at the facility.  
***Correct by August 9, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
